utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: Say Rachel, I was wondering if you'd like to go to a movie with me sometime. As my lover! Nnnsch, too out there. Maybe you'd just like to ah, get something to eat with me sometime? As my lover.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi! All right, let's go shoppin'!!

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Um, y'know, before we go ah, there's something I need to say.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, okay.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: I've kinda of had this ah, this crush on you. But since you were with Ross, I-I didn't do anything about it. But, now that you're not, I'd really like to ask you out sometime. So-so that's-that's what I'm doing, now.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow! Umm....

utterance.speaker: Gunther
utterance.content: I dropped a cup.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: ...so y'know, that's why, within a few years, that voice recognition is gonna be pretty much standard on any computer you buy. Y'know, so you could be like-like, 'Wash my car.' 'Clean my room.' It's not gonna be able to do any of those things, but it'll understand what you're saying.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, this is so great.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Yeah, it was.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right then. Bye.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello, people who do not live here.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hi! Hello!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I gave you a key for emergencies!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: We were out of Doritos.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, how'd the date go with Mr. Millionaire?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mr. Millionaire, new from Snooty Playthings! Third wife sold separately.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: He's great! I mean we have such a good time together! He's so funny, and sooo sweet, and I'm not attracted to him at all!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Still?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Noo!! It's driving me crazy. I mean every other way he's like the perfect guy, he has everything. Plus! He actually has everything.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Life-sized Imperial Storm Troopers from Sharper Image?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Two.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow!! Can Joey and I put them on and fight?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I guess he musta gotten the part in that play.

utterance.speaker: Monica and Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, either that, or Gloria Estefan was right, eventually, the rhythm is going to get you.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Joe. How's it going?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Good. Hey.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, so you're playing Adrienne, huh?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Yes. Are you one of the retarded cousins?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, no. Ah, I playing your husband, Victor. I'm Joey Tribianni.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Hi, nice to meet you. Kate Miller.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So the ah, play's pretty great, huh?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. I love Jennifer Van Murray's work. She's so brilliantly incisive when it comes to deconstructing the psyche of the American middle class.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, forget about it. She rocks!

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Where do I know you from?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dr. Drake Remoray. Days of Our Lives. Voted most datable neurosurgeon by Teen Beat.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: No, that's not it. So, you're a soap actor? Well this must be pretty exciting for you to be in a real play, hmm?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, I've done plays before. I'm a serious actor.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: That info-mercial! For the milk carton spout thing! You're-you're-you're the guy that doesn't know how to pour milk!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: See, I actually can pour milk, but I got you believing that I couldn't. Now, see, that's acting.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Right, at the end, you choked on a cookie.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, that was real.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow! I cannot believe Mark asked you out.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What, so what are you gonna tell him?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, I told him I would think about it, but I'm gonna tell him no.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I mean I think I'd say no to anybody right now. Oh, but it was so strange. I mean I'm standing there with this charming, cute guy, who's asking me to go out with him, which I'm allowed to do, and I felt guilty. Y'know, like I'd be cheating on Ross or something.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow. So, okay, maybe that means that, you're not over Ross yet and you have issues with your father.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I don't have any issues with my Father.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, so it's probably just the Ross thing then.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I hate this woman!! I hate her! She told everyone in the company about that info-mercial, and now they all keep asking me to open their drinks. Okay, and whenever I can't do it, they're all like-like laughing at me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Chandler and Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So Rachel called. Wants to see me. Going over in a minute.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wow, what-what do you think she wants?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well, maybe the crazy fog has lifted and she realises that life without me ah sucks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It's possible. You are very loveable, I'd miss you if I broke up with you. I was just trying to be supportive.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Then be supportive like a guy.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: If I broke up with you, I'd miss you.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You ah, wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah. Ahh, here's a box of your stuff.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, y'know, it's just like hats, and a shirt, and CD's, just sort of stuff that you've left here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What are you doing? Are you trying to hurt me? Or something?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. Ross, it, it just seems that y'know it's time we-we y'know, move on. I mean, I mean don't' you think?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, I-I really do. Hey! This-this was a gift?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, you got that for free from the museum gift shop.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's still a gift! I got it from the gift shop!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, all right, give me the mug! I'll keep the mug.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No!! Y'know-y'know don't do me any favours. In fact, where, where's the rest of my stuff?! Huh? Like-like my umm, Hey, this book is mine!! And-and-and, and that T-shirt you sleep in? I'd like that back too. Yes, I do.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know how much I love that T-shirt! You never even where that T-shirt!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm just trying to help you, move on.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you are a petty man. You are a petty, petty....

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Petty...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Petty...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Petty...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Petty...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Petty...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Small...

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Small...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You are so just doing this out of spite.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Awwwahuh, no, no, no!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Huh?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I'm-I'm gonna wear this all the time! I love this shirt!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You have not worn that T-shirt since you were 15!! It doesn't even fit you anymore!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: yeah-yeah-yeah!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh-oh, okay, okay! If you don't mind I'm gonna the rest of my stuff, and relax, in my favourite shirt. You have a pleasant evening.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, you're like a zillionaire?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And you're our age. You're our age.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Y'know what, you should like, you should buy a state and then just name it after yourself.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: What like Pete Dakota?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, or, or, or, Mississ-Pete.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, oh, I got it! Pete-Chicago.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That's not a state Joe.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, and Mississ-Pete is?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: I got to go, so ah, I'll see you guys later.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You're our age!

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: So ah, we on for tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Absolutely! Now get out of here you!! Okay, I'm running out of places I can touch him! Look, is there something wrong with me? I mean why am I only attracted to guys where there's no future? Either they're too old, or they're too young, and then there's Pete who's-who's crazy about me, and who's absolutely perfect for me, and there's like zip going on! I mean, seriously, does it sound like something's wrong with me?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, kinda.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Happy?! Is that what I'm supposed to be Vic? Happy?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, why don't you tell me what you're supposed to be! Huh? Because I sure as hell can't figure it out! I talk to you and nothin'. You look at me, and it's nothin'. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Tasty! I'm really starting to feel like you guys have a history, it's-it's nice.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: I have a question about this scene.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Yes?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Well, I don't understand why Adrienne's attracted to Victor.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Peel the onion. First of all, he's good looking.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: I think my character's gonna need a little bit more of reason than that.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, hey, how about this one. Ah, it's says so in the script! Y'know ah, I-I don't know why my character likes you either, I mean it says in the script here that you're a bitch.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: It doesn't say that in the script.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It does in mine!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can blow dry it. I can put gel on it. It doesn't matter, I still wind up with this little cowlicky thing on the middle part of my head. It's so annoying. Does it bug you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You bug me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is there any chance you didn't see that?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ross! You gotta stop! Okay?! You can't just stare through the peep hole for three hours! You're gonna get peep eye!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I knew it! I knew it! I always knew she liked him! Y'know, she'd say no, but here we are! Right? We just broke up, first thing she does!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You didn't just break up.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey, it's been like three weeks!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You slept with somebody three hours after you thought you broke up. I mean bullets have left guns slower!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Here they come, here they come. Oh-ho, if she kisses him goodnight, I'm gonna kill myself, I swear. I can't, I can't watch this. Come on, date over! Date over! Uh-oh, here we go, she's going in.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: She's going in. Wait! He's going in! He's going in!! The door's closed! I, I can't see anything but the door closed!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And the inventor of the door rests happily in his grave.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I have to do something. I mean, I have, I have to stop it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Stop what?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don't know, but I ah, I have the feeling that my being there will do it. I'll go over and I will borrow something. Juice!! I need juice!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No!! You can't!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Look, they must be stopped!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I am your friend, and I am not gonna let you do this!! You are surprisingly strong!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I need juice! People need juice!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look man!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: People need juice!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Listen to me!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Juice, I need...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: She's moving on! Okay, if it's not this guy, it's gonna be somebody else! And unless you're thinking about subletting my peep hole, you are going to have to get used to the fact that the relationship is over! Okay, man? It's over.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It's just I miss her so much.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Why do all you're coffee mugs have numbers on the bottom?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. That's so Monica can keep track. That way if one on them is missing, she can be like, 'Where's number 27?!'

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Y'know what?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: No. And I don't think I'm gonna want to.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I can't do this.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Yep. Yep, that's what I didn't want to know.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, oh, Mark, I'm doing this for the wrong reasons, y'know? I'm just doing it to get back at Ross. I'm sorry, it's not very fair to you.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Ahh! Fair, schmair! Y'know? Look, if you want to get back at Ross, I am here for you. Really? No-no, I say-I say, I say we get back at him right on this couch. Right here!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God. I'm sorry about this.

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: That's okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: Mark
utterance.content: Yeah. I can just go home and get back at him by myself.

utterance.speaker: Spokeswoman
utterance.content: ...has become the penicillin of the twenty-first century. And so today, this hospital is about to take major steps toward leading that revolution. It is truly ironic, on one hand consider the size...

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Hey, can I ask you something?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Where are we?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, with all these doctors and nurses, I'm gonna say, midget rodeo.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Just tell me the truth.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Umm, y'know, I don't think, I don't think I told you this, but umm, I just got out of a really serious relationship.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Wasn't that like a year ago?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So I did tell you. Okay, y'know, that really isn't the thing. Umm, the thing is that, right now I'm just in a place in my life where I need to focus on me. Y'know what I mean?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. I know that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I so wanna be attracted to you.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: But you're not. Okay, good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Y'know what, don't be. This is not, don't be, 'cause it's not so bad.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It's not?

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: I know I'm no John Bon Jovi, or someone who find attractive, I'm just, I think, y'know, that you might end up feeling differently.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, um, look I-I don't want this to come our wrong, but ah, you seem awfully confident for a guy I just told I wasn't attracted too.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: Yeah, stupidly charming isn't' it? Well listen let's, you wanna get something to eat? 'Cause this place is kinda depressing.

utterance.speaker: Spokeswoman
utterance.content: And the man who made all this possible... Mr. Peter Becker.

utterance.speaker: Pete
utterance.content: One second.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I don't think this town is big enough for both of us to relax in. Draw!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I wasn't doing anything. Uh-oh, what did she do now?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just because she went to Yale drama, she thinks she's like the greatest actress since, since, sliced bread!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, Sliced Bread, a wonderful Lady MacBeth.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: God, I just, I hate her! I hate her!! With her, 'Oh, I'm so talented.' and 'Oh, I'm so pretty,' and 'Ooh, I smell so good.'

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I think somebody has a crush on somebody.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Chandler, can we please stay focused on my problem here?! Y'know?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I'm talking about you. You big, big freak.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh. Ohh. Ohh, you're out of your mind.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, you have nothing but talk about her for the last 48 hours! If you were in a school yard you'd be pulling her pigtails and pushing her down now!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, yeah?! Then how come I keep thinking about her in all these sexual scenarios and stuff huh?!

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Happy?! Is that what I'm supposed to be Vic? Happy?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, why don't you tell me what you're supposed to be! Huh? Because I sure as hell can't figure it out! I talk to you and it's nothin'. You look at me, and nothin'. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: You guys make me fly! High! Okay, we're gonna pick it up here, tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Well, that was ah...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Better?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah, it was definitely an improvement. G'night.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ah, Kate?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You ah, you forgot your shoes.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: I'm probably gonna need those. Huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, listen you ah....

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: ...feel like getting a cup of coffee?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Umm.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Kate?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: You ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: The Director
utterance.content: Very nice. Very nice.

utterance.speaker: Kate
utterance.content: So umm, I'll see you tomorrow, huh?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah sure, goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! Why isn't it Spiderman? Y'know like Goldman, Silverman...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: 'Cause it's-it's not his last name.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It isn't?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, it's not like, like Phil Spiderman. He's a spider, man. Y'know like ah, like Goldman is a last name, but there's no Gold Man.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay. There should be Gold Man!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, Rach, how was work?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, great. Although I did sit down where there wasn't a chair.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: By the way, Ross dropped by a box of your stuff.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, I guess I had that one coming. I'm just gonna throw it out, it's probably just a bunch of shampoo and...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Something wrong?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, ahh, what kind of powers would Gold Man have?

utterance.content: Okay well, he would turn things to gold.

utterance.content: What about things that are already gold?

utterance.content: Ahh, his work is done.

utterance.content: Okay, let's play my game now.
